    • Method Detail

      • address

        public FluentAddressListAssert<P> address(org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super Iterable<String>> matcher)
        Make assertions on the email addresses (without personal).

        Email address parts can be checked independently:

        • address: "recipient@sii.fr"
        • personal: "Recipient Name"
        • textual: "Recipient Name <recipient@sii.fr>"
         .receivedMessages().message(0).to()
    .address(hasItems("recipient@sii.fr"))
        Will check if the list of recipient email addresses of the first message contains exactly "recipient@sii.fr". 
         .receivedMessages().every().to()
    .address(hasItems("recipient@sii.fr"))
        Will check if the list of recipient email addresses of every message contains exactly "recipient@sii.fr".
        Parameters:
        matcher - the assertion to apply on the email addresses
        Returns:
        the fluent API for chaining assertions on received message(s)

      • textual

        public FluentAddressListAssert<P> textual(org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super Iterable<String>> matcher)
        Make assertions on the email addresses (textual form).

        Email address parts can be checked independently:

        • address: "recipient@sii.fr"
        • personal: "Recipient Name"
        • textual: "Recipient Name <recipient@sii.fr>"
         .receivedMessages().message(0).to()
    .textual(hasItems("Recipient Name <recipient@sii.fr>"))
        Will check if the list of recipient email addresses (personal with address) of the first message contains exactly "Recipient Name <recipient@sii.fr>". 
         .receivedMessages().every().to()
    .textual(hasItems("Recipient Name <recipient@sii.fr>"))
        Will check if the list of recipient email addresses (personal with address) of every message contains exactly "Recipient Name <recipient@sii.fr>".
        Parameters:
        matcher - the assertion to apply on the email addresses
        Returns:
        the fluent API for chaining assertions on received message(s)

      • type

        public FluentAddressListAssert<P> type(org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super Iterable<String>> matcher)
        Make assertions on the email address types. 
         .receivedMessages().message(0).to()
    .type(hasItems("rfc822"))
        Will check if the list of recipient email address types of the first message contains exactly "rfc822". 
         .receivedMessages().every().to()
    .type(hasItems("rfc822"))
        Will check if the list of recipient email address types of every message contains exactly "rfc822".
        Parameters:
        matcher - the assertion to apply on the email addresses
        Returns:
        the fluent API for chaining assertions on received message(s)

      • personal

        public FluentAddressListAssert<P> personal(org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super Iterable<String>> matcher)
        Make assertions on the email addresses (personal information only).

        Email address parts can be checked independently:

        • address: "recipient@sii.fr"
        • personal: "Recipient Name"
        • textual: "Recipient Name <recipient@sii.fr>"
         .receivedMessages().message(0).to()
    .personal(hasItems("Recipient Name"))
        Will check if the list of recipient email addresses (personal information) of the first message contains exactly "Recipient Name". 
         .receivedMessages().every().to()
    .personal(hasItems("Recipient Name"))
        Will check if the list of recipient email addresses (personal information) of every message contains exactly "Recipient Name".
        Parameters:
        matcher - the assertion to apply on the email addresses
        Returns:
        the fluent API for chaining assertions on received message(s)
